Package servlets

Class HtmlLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • servlets.HtmlLoader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Servlet
    public class HtmlLoader
extends java.lang.Object
implements Servlet
    The HtmlLoader servlet is responsible for serving HTML files from a specified directory. It handles GET requests to the /app/ endpoint and serves static HTML content. Features: - Serves HTML files from a configured directory - Automatically appends .html extension if missing - Defaults to index.html when no specific file is requested - Provides custom 404 error page for missing files - Handles UTF-8 encoding for all responses

      Creates a new HtmlLoader that serves files from the specified directory.

    • Method Detail

      • getHtmlFilePath

        public static java.nio.file.Path getHtmlFilePath​(java.lang.String folder,
                                                 java.lang.String fileName)
        Constructs the full path to an HTML file given the base folder and filename.
        Parameters:
        folder - The base folder containing HTML files
        fileName - The name of the HTML file to load
        Returns:
        Path object representing the full path to the HTML file

      • handle

        public void handle​(RequestParser.RequestInfo request,
                   java.io.OutputStream out)
        Handles HTTP GET requests for HTML files. The method performs the following steps: 1. Extracts the requested file name from the URI 2. Adds .html extension if missing 3. Checks if the file exists 4. Serves the file content or an appropriate error page
        Specified by:
        handle in interface Servlet
        Parameters:
        request - The HTTP request information
        out - The output stream to write the response to
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there's an error reading or writing files

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Closes any resources held by the servlet. Currently, this servlet doesn't hold any resources that need closing.
        Specified by:
        close in interface Servlet
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there's an error closing resources
